STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
November 12, 2024
Chad Hannahs
INGHAM COUNTY DHHS
5303 S CEDAR ST,
LANSING, MI, 48911-3800
RE: License#: CP330201190
Dear Mr. Hannahs:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 11/01/24. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Douglas Turrill, Licensing Consultant
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City MI 49684
231-383-5531
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
RENEWAL INSPECTION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION

Services

Chief Administrator: Chad Hannahs
Name of Agency: INGHAM COUNTY DHHS

LANSING, MI 48911-3800
Agency Telephone #: 5178879791
Original Issuance Date: 10/01/1991

children in foster home, Supervise
Independent Living

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home
certified by another agency the borrowing
agency shall have a record containing all the
following:
• (a) Approval from the certifying agency
authorizing the placement of a child in the
home.
Three borrowed home files were reviewed. One of three files documented that
certifying agency approval occurred after placement of the child.
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home
certified by another agency the borrowing
agency shall have a record containing all the
following:
• (b) Verification that the foster parent is
willing to accept the foster child.

Three borrowed home files were reviewed. Two of three files did not document
that the foster parent was willing to accept the child.
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home
certified by another agency the borrowing
agency shall have a record containing all the
following:
• (f) Documentation that the foster parent
has received orientation to the policies of
the borrowing agency.
Three borrowed home files were reviewed. One of three files documented that the
foster parent received orientation to the policies of the borrowing agency after
placement of the child.
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home
certified by another agency the borrowing
agency shall have a record containing all the
following:
• (g) A copy of the foster parent /agency
agreement signed by the foster parent
and the borrowing agency.
Three borrowed home files were reviewed. One of three files did not document
that the foster parent received a copy of the parent agency agreement.
CPA Rule 400.12312 Foster parent training
• (2) The foster parent training plan must provide
for all the following:
• (b) Not less than 6 hours of training
annually for each licensee after the time
periods specified in subdivisions (a) of
this subrule.

Eight foster home files were reviewed. One of eight did not contain
documentation that the foster parent completed six hours of training during the
licensing period.
CPA Rule 400.12510 Independent living agreement
• (2) The agreement must be signed and dated by
the youth and the social service worker. The
agreement must be reviewed with the youth at
least once every 90 calendar days and a copy
provided to the youth.
Three independent living files were reviewed. One of three did not document an
updated independent living agreement reviewed and signed by the youth.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (1) An agency shall develop service plans with
the child, the child's parents or legal guardian,
the referring agency, and other parties involved
in providing needed services, or medical care,
unless the agency documents why any of the
entities have not been involved.
Eight foster care files were reviewed. Four of eight files each contained one or
more service plans that were not signed by the foster parent or parent.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
10/18/23 Interim Inspection. CAP approved 11/13/23.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (a) Child's name.
Eight foster care files were reviewed. One of eight files did not document that the
foster parent received the foster child’s name before placement of the child.

CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (b) Child's date of birth.
Eight foster care files were reviewed. One of eight files did not document that the
foster parent received the foster childs date of birth before placement of the child.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (c) Available known information about the
child's health.
Eight foster care files were reviewed. One of eight files did not document that the
foster parent received all available known information about the child's health
before placement of the child.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (d) Any known history of abuse or neglect
of the child.
Eight foster care files were reviewed. One of eight files did not document that the
foster parent received any known history of abuse or neglect before placement of
the child.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:

• (e) All known emotional and
psychological factors relating to the care
of the child.
Eight foster care files were reviewed. One of eight files did not document that the
foster parent received all known emotional and psychological factors relating to
the care of the child before placement of the child.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (f) All known behaviors of the child.
Eight foster care files were reviewed. One of eight files did not document that the
foster parent received all known behaviors of the child before placement of the
child.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (g) Circumstances necessitating
placement or replacement of the child.
Eight foster care files were reviewed. One of eight files did not document that the
foster parent received information regarding circumstances necessitating
placement or replacement of the child before placement.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (h) Any other known information to enable
the foster parent to provide a stable, safe,
and healthy environment for the foster

child and the foster family, including
information about siblings who do not
reside in the foster home as provided in
federal law.
Eight foster care files were reviewed. One of eight files did not document that the
foster parent received any other known information to enable the foster parent to
provide a stable, safe, and healthy environment for the foster child and the foster
family, including information about siblings who do not reside in the foster home
as provided in federal law.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (i) Name of assigned social service
worker.
Eight foster care files were reviewed. One of eight files did not document that the
foster parent received the name of assigned social service worker.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Rule 400.12415 (a) Incident reports. Discussed the requirement that
incident reports are to be submitted to the consultant. Only those incidents
named under the rule are to be submitted.
• DCWL review of Corrective Action Plans (CAP). The agency was
informed that starting January 1, 2024, interim and renewal audit CAP's will
be reviewed with the agency at three months and six months. The assigned
Consultant for the agency will work with the agency in conducting CAP
reviews. This process for special investigation CAP reviews was implemented
previously.
• Rule 400.12209 (2) (a) Orientation and Training. The agency was informed
that all the training requirements listed under (2) (a) are required yearly for
foster care workers carrying a caseload as well as for supervisors who may
be carrying a caseload.

V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or offered at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were 0 substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were 0 incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The
agency submitted an approved corrective action plan on November 13, 2023, in
response to those violations established during the October 18, 2023 Interim
Inspection. The Interim Inspection established rule violations for the following:
R400.124133 -1-f, Medical and dental care policy, R 400.12418-5, Development of
service plans, and R 400.12421-2, Visitation and family time, in person contact.
The current Renewal Inspection established a repeat violation of R 400.12418-5,
Development of service plans. The agency CAP was successful in preventing
repeat violations of the other two violations.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators Annual Assessment was reviewed. The assessment
addressed the correction action plan developed in response to those violations
established during the 2023 Interim Inspection. Barriers were discussed and it was
noted that the staff turnover rate had dropped by 20% over the last year. The
assessment also reported the agency has four staff vacancies and it was
anticipated those positions would be filled within thirty days. The vacancies were
due to staff transitioning into other child welfare roles. The assessment also
discussed emergency placements for children in a hospital or residential facility
and the difficulty this can present at times.
Financial Overview
The agency is a local county DHHS office and financial records were not available.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff reported feeling supported by their respective supervisors and the agency
administration. Also reported was an overall feeling that the agency team functions
effectively, and workers are supportive of one another. Staff reported that
supervisors can always be contacted at any time 24/7 for support. One worker
reported that at times the hours worked can be long, but supervisors work to
compensate workers for this.

Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in a modern well maintained local Department of Health and
Human Services building in Lansing. The agency is well equipped and has
experienced some recent renovations. Office space is sufficient. CHRI documents
were observed to be secured.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Analyst did not find any safety issues in the homes.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
November 8, 2024
_____________________________________
Douglas Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
November 12, 2024
_____________________________________
Samantha Way Date
Area Manager
